## Typedefs

### LLVMRemarkArgRef {#ga5af94d02e0cfc296f48e4c6026c3a505}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>typedef struct LLVMRemarkOpaqueArg&#42; LLVMRemarkArgRef</>}>
Element of the &quot;Args&quot; list.

The key might give more information about what the semantics of the value are, e.g. &quot;Callee&quot; will tell you that the value is a symbol that names a function.


<SectionUser title="Since">
REMARKS&#95;API&#95;VERSION=0
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h/#l00109">109</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h">Remarks.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>typedef struct LLVMRemarkOpaqueString&#42; LLVMRemarkStringRef</>}>
String containing a buffer and a length.

The buffer is not guaranteed to be zero-terminated.

## Functions

### LLVMRemarkArgGetDebugLoc() {#gac957fc4c2494542def206b494cec3304}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMRemarkDebugLocRef LLVMRemarkArgGetDebugLoc (<a href="#ga5af94d02e0cfc296f48e4c6026c3a505">LLVMRemarkArgRef</a> Arg)</>}>
Returns the debug location that is attached to the value of this argument.

If there is no debug location, the return value will be <code>NULL</code>.


<SectionUser title="Since">
REMARKS&#95;API&#95;VERSION=0
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h/#l00133">133</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h">Remarks.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remark-cpp/#l00100">100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remark-cpp">Remark.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMRemarkArgGetKey() {#ga04799d41da890b231715aea5bf8dbe4d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMRemarkStringRef LLVMRemarkArgGetKey (<a href="#ga5af94d02e0cfc296f48e4c6026c3a505">LLVMRemarkArgRef</a> Arg)</>}>
Returns the key of an argument.

The key defines what the value is, and the same key can appear multiple times in the list of arguments.


<SectionUser title="Since">
REMARKS&#95;API&#95;VERSION=0
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h/#l00117">117</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h">Remarks.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remark-cpp/#l00091">91</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remark-cpp">Remark.cpp</a>.

  prototype={<>LLVMRemarkStringRef LLVMRemarkArgGetValue (<a href="#ga5af94d02e0cfc296f48e4c6026c3a505">LLVMRemarkArgRef</a> Arg)</>}>

This is a string that can contain newlines.

### LLVMRemarkEntryGetFirstArg() {#ga85761e9b8c26fd7989dfd64fe8b796c8}

<MemberDefinition

If there are no arguments in <code>Remark</code>, the return value will be <code>NULL</code>.

The lifetime of the returned value is bound to the lifetime of <code>Remark</code>.

### LLVMRemarkParserCreateBitstream() {#ga3876e400217122e91a34c002981bc82d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMRemarkParserRef LLVMRemarkParserCreateBitstream (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> void &#42; Buf, uint64&#95;t Size)</>}>
Creates a remark parser that can be used to parse the buffer located in <code>Buf</code> of size <code>Size</code> bytes.

<code>Buf</code> cannot be <code>NULL</code>.

This function should be paired with <a href="#gad7ebecfc91d543900784cb97c6302d47">LLVMRemarkParserDispose()</a> to avoid leaking resources.


<SectionUser title="Since">
REMARKS&#95;API&#95;VERSION=1
</SectionUser>

</MemberDefinition>

Creates a remark parser that can be used to parse the buffer located in <code>Buf</code> of size <code>Size</code> bytes.

<code>Buf</code> cannot be <code>NULL</code>.

This function should be paired with <a href="#gad7ebecfc91d543900784cb97c6302d47">LLVMRemarkParserDispose()</a> to avoid leaking resources.

### LLVMRemarkParserGetErrorMessage() {#gab870147e749d296c569783d7539b6656}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const char &#42; LLVMRemarkParserGetErrorMessage (<a href="#ga8065752effe66fd6b55586f04028cccd">LLVMRemarkParserRef</a> Parser)</>}>
Returns a null-terminated string containing an error message.

In case of no error, the result is <code>NULL</code>.

The memory of the string is bound to the lifetime of <code>Parser</code>. If <a href="#gad7ebecfc91d543900784cb97c6302d47">LLVMRemarkParserDispose()</a> is called, the memory of the string will be released.


<SectionUser title="Since">
REMARKS&#95;API&#95;VERSION=0
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h/#l00322">322</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h">Remarks.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkparser-cpp/#l00169">169</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkparser-cpp">RemarkParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMRemarkParserGetNext() {#gada1d7ab2d57b735d67fa095bc099cc7f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMRemarkEntryRef LLVMRemarkParserGetNext (<a href="#ga8065752effe66fd6b55586f04028cccd">LLVMRemarkParserRef</a> Parser)</>}>
Returns the next remark in the file.

The value pointed to by the return value needs to be disposed using a call to <a href="#ga4c5e73440d732e43d91a04128fe689de">LLVMRemarkEntryDispose()</a>.

All the entries in the returned value that are of <a href="#ga4029ca629a9c507071bc942d42192ad3">LLVMRemarkStringRef</a> type will become invalidated once a call to LLVMRemarkParserDispose is made.

If the parser reaches the end of the buffer, the return value will be <code>NULL</code>.

In the case of an error, the return value will be <code>NULL</code>, and:

1) <a href="#ga88083b5d141c27d1dd14dc4d2f0f81a2">LLVMRemarkParserHasError()</a> will return <code>1</code>.

2) <a href="#gab870147e749d296c569783d7539b6656">LLVMRemarkParserGetErrorMessage()</a> will return a descriptive error message.

An error may occur if:

1) An argument is invalid.

2) There is a parsing error. This can occur on things like malformed YAML.

3) There is a Remark semantic error. This can occur on well-formed files with missing or extra fields.

Here is a quick example of the usage:


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">LLVMRemarkParserRef Parser = LLVMRemarkParserCreateYAML(Buf, Size);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">LLVMRemarkEntryRef Remark = NULL;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">while ((Remark = LLVMRemarkParserGetNext(Parser))) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">   // use Remark</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">   LLVMRemarkEntryDispose(Remark); // Release memory.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">bool HasError = LLVMRemarkParserHasError(Parser);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">LLVMRemarkParserDispose(Parser);</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>



<SectionUser title="Since">
REMARKS&#95;API&#95;VERSION=0
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h/#l00302">302</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/remarks-h">Remarks.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkparser-cpp/#l00143">143</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkparser-cpp">RemarkParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
